required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Ripening in Obese Women: Efficacy of 25 mcg Versus 50 mcg of Misoprostol
clinical_study.official_title: Cervical Ripening in Obese Women: a Prospective, Randomized Trial Comparing Efficacy of 25 mcg Versus 50 mcg of Misoprostol

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective clinical trial to determine if 50 mcg versus 25 mcg po every four hours of misoprostol has improved efficacy and similar safety in obese women undergoing cesarean section.

detailed_description.textblock:
We will perform a prospective, randomized, double-blind clinical trial with parallel assignment.
Obese women (delivery BMI 30 or more) who agree to participation will be randomly designated to receive either 25 mcg po q 4 hour (control) misoprosol versus 50 mcg po q 4 hours. Our primary outcome will be the rate of successful induction. Secondary outcomes will include ability to achieve a Bishop score greater than 7, time to active labor, and safety data including rate of tachysystole, non-reassuring fetal status, NICU admission.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Parallel design randomized trial. Two study groups: control (25 mcg) intervention (50 mcg)
study_design_info.masking_description: Both arms will receive identical appearing drug made by the Investigational Drug Unit of the Pharmacy.

primary_outcome.description: Successful induction defined as a vaginal delivery following labor induction.

secondary_outcome.description: Bishop score of greater than 7 (Bishop score designated per protocol based upon cervical dilation, effacement, station, consistency and position).

secondary_outcome.measure: Specific time interval from start of induction to active labor
secondary_outcome.description: We will measure the interval (hours) between start of cervical ripening and active labor defined as reaching a cervical dilation of 6 cm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of tachysystole, fetal nonreassuring status, uterine rupture
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of the following as categorical variables: tachysystole (any delay in study medication administration for greater than 5 contractions/10 minute window), non-reassuring fetal status (any evaluation of the fetal tracing that leads to delays in study drug administration secondary to concerns for the fetal status), NICU admission, uterine rupture

clinical_study.condition: Induction of Labor Affected Fetus / Newborn

arm_group.description: Standard of care, misoprostol 25 mcg po every four hours
Misoprostol 50 mcg po every four hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Labor induction, BMI of 30 or greater, English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior cesarean section, uterine tachysystole (5 contractions/ 10 minutes) on admission, Contraindication to labor induction
